hero: Hi there! My name is Franco, I'm a 26 years old aspiring Front End developer from Buenos Aires, Argentina. I have experience building sites with React, Next, Vue and am always on the lookout for an excuse to learn a new framework or library! Truth be told, I just love all things programming related. Be it games, cool algorithms to work around specific problems, AI or modding pretty much anything to make it a more personal experience, I constantly find myself fiddling with *some* type of code. Welcome to my page!

panels.title: where-i-work
panels.description: I'm currently doing freelance work (have been for 2 years now) as well as volunteering as a professor at Universidad Maimonides, Argentina. This is where i studied, and the professors who taught me are now my colleagues! I love helping out wherever i can, and i'm a firm believer that a group of people that support each other in the pursuit of achieving something can outdo any genius on any given day.

panels.title: my-projects
panels.description: I have completed 8 projects for clients, altough a good part of them were made with tools such as Wordpress or TiendaNube, which while i fully respect developers who decide to pursue careers utilizing them to create websites, it's not really for me. This said, I do have 2 projects I'm very proud of that are a great display of my skills: One is a chess app that showcases inherent complex logic and UI handling, and the other is a real world application for calculating badly delivered energy and the corresponding penalties that is being used to this day, saving millions of dollars for the company! If you have the time, I'd love to tell you all about them!

panels.title: my-hobbies
panels.description: I'm a bit of a mixed bag when it comes to the activities i enjoy doing on my free time; it ranges from gaming to sightseeing, gardening and playing with my pets, going to the gym and of course modding all sorts of things. I love nature, the beauty in the different shades of green you can find in trees, plants and even grass and mushrooms made green my favorite color, and there's just something incredibly calming and wholesome about watching something I planted grow up, become a beautiful plant or tree and getting to see them thrive. Touching grass really does go a long way, especially when a significant part of your life is bound to a computer and that logical space within your brain that lets you abstract things into bits and pieces that you can communicate to a computer.

panels.title: my-journey
panels.description: I've been learning programming for about 6 years now, my first real interaction with a code editor was on my first year at Universidad Maimonides, Argentina. I wasn't quite sure what I wanted to follow career-wise, so i went for a career that had many aspects I had interest in, such as graphic design, media editing (photoshop, premiere, aftereffects, etc), animation, 3D Modeling, and naturally, programming. This was, however, not even close in terms of how much the different subjects interested me once i actually got to do some hands on learning, as I immediately loved the amount of control I have when coding and just how powerful of a tool a computer is. I can only wonder what someone like Sir Isaac Newton would have been able to accomplish with a computer, and I'm extremely excited to see what I can learn from people who have surpassed my own level some 10, 20 or even 30+ years ago! I'm currently reaping the rewards of my hard work too, The people who have worked with me have all said very encouraging things to me as a professional, and the college I studied in even thought I was good enough to teach at a University. I'm now ready to dive into the world of constant production, with a skillset that doesn't just involve programming, but rather a full fledged Multi-Media professional capable of working with and around all kinds of professionals that involve creating wonderful digital products!

panels.title: technologies-and-languages
panels.description: I'm bilingual! I can speak and write both English and Spanish at a very fluent level. Regarding programming languages for web development, I have really only used HTML/JS/CSS based technologies. Here's a list:
